At first, you could not figure out what was going on. Everything seemed much larger than what they appeared to be the day before. You pulled the covers off yourself and discovered you were in a body that was not your own. You were somehow now inside the body of a little girl! On instinct, you screamed.

No sooner the screamed left your lips, you heard hurried footfalls in the hall before your bedroom door swung open. Your mom entered with your older sister, Sarah. She had just turned 13. "Stay calm, dear." Rushing over to you, mom said. "You are going to be okay."

"You call this okay!?" Motioning to your body, you asked. "I'm not supposed to be a little girl!"

"It will be easier for everyone this way." Chiming in, Sarah stated. "You see, the women in our family possess certain abilities."

"You mean that you two are some kind of witches?" Wincing, you asked.

Mom smiled. "Well, yes." Simply, she replied. "The only catch is you have to be a girl to use that magic and we did not want you to feel left out."

"So you turned me into a little girl?" Unnerved, you asked. "Why not a teenage girl?"

"Actually, that would have been more dangerous." Wincing, mom said. She sighed. "Both boys and girls go through a phase where their bodies and minds undergo various changes..."

"It's called puberty." Unimpressed, you said. "I did take health class, mom."

Mom sighed. "There are things girls are expected to know once they reach their teen years." Trying another approach, she said. "You have no such knowledge. It's best to start you out young."

"That and this is not a permanent situation." Jumping in, Sarah added. She winked at you. "Unless you get to like being a girl."

"This is a trail run, if you will." Smiling, mom said. "If you like being a girl and having magic, you will grow up again as a girl. If you find that you do not like it after a year, I will change you back into your original form of a teenage boy."

"You are going to have this one year experience weather you like it or not... Tina." Stating your new name, Sarah said. "Just go with it and give us your decision at the end of the year."

"Now then, Tina." Kindly, mom said. "What would you like to do on your first day of being a little girl?"

15533222.content:
My name is John Saunders, I'm 14 years old. I live on the Gulf coast with my parents and my older sister Kate, who is only 11 months older than me. My best friends are Dan Johnson (14) and his cousin Becky Johnson (14). For the last few days, I've been feeling queasy and uncomfortable. My family and I thought it was just food poisoning. We're about to find out just how wrong we are.
But let me start from the beginning:
It was a nice sunny day on the Gulf Coast of Florida. I was spending the afternoon lounging by the pool with my sister Kate and my friends Becky and Dan. It was nice to be able to come outside for a change, I had been stuck inside the last few days with an inexplicable stomach bug; I spent the better part of yesterday throwing up. I was still feeling queasy but it was not anything I could not handle.
I walked outside from the kitchen with a pitcher of lemonade. As I made my way over to the pool, I heard Kate talking with the others about their plans for the weekend. Kate and I were not going to be doing much; we were stuck watching the house while our folks went out of town for my dad’s 30th high school reunion. Becky and Dan were both going to a family reunion at their grandparent’s house in Miami. I was mildly annoyed by that last part; because although I loved my sister and considered her to be a friend, I was bummed that I would only have her to hang out with this weekend.
As I sat down on one of the chairs Becky, who was in the center of the pool, said, “You guys are lucky you’re staying here this weekend.” Swimming to the edge, she said, “I’d rather be here than listen to my family wonder why I don’t have a boyfriend yet.”
“Stop complaining about that, Beck.” Sighing, Dan said, “Nana brought that up one time last Christmas and you’re blowing it all out of proportion.”
“Put yourself in my position, Dan; I’m the oldest girl in our generation, I’m the only one old enough to be dating.” Groaning, Becky said, “Just once I’d like Nana to find some fault with Christie and Meaghan; or hell, even you.”
“I’m sure your grandma just looking out for what’s best for you, Becky.” Chuckling, I said, “If it makes you feel any better, I know you’ll find a boyfriend soon.”
“Thanks, John.” Smiling, she said, “I hope so.”
“I don’t see what all the fuss is about dating.” Climbing into the water, Kate said, “I haven’t had a boyfriend since middle school, and I’m fine with it.”
“If my mom heard you say that, she’d say you’ve got your priorities straight.” Pausing, Dan said, “She doesn’t want me dating until at least my junior year, so I can focus on school.”
“Can we please stop talking about our love lives?” Getting up from my chair, I went over to the pool edge and jumped in. “We’re only 14 years old; we have plenty of time to worry about dating.”
“John’s right.” Smiling, Kate said, “Right now the only thing we have to worry about is who's going to win best 2 out of 3 in a game of chicken.”
Everyone smiled at the mention of chicken. As Dan and Kate climbed into the water, I said, “Let’s make things interesting; Becky and me vs. Kate and Dan.”
“Sounds like a plan to me.”
15533222.title: Other

155332221.content:
The four of us played chicken for about an hour; with Kate and Dan eventually winning six games to nine. At that point, the weather was starting to turn ugly; and wind and rain for a developing tropical storm struck the coast. As we got out of the water, Becky said, “We’ll have to do a rematch after Dan and I get back; in the mean time I have to change and get to the Peterson’s house. I’m supposed to be babysitting their daughter tonight.”
I felt sorry for Becky when I heard that because Cyndi Peterson was a 5-year-old known for being rather hyperactive. “Good luck with that, Beck.”
After saying goodbye to Dan and Becky, I joined Kate inside. As I walked over to the fridge, Kate looked to me and said, “Are you okay, John? You’re still looking kind of green.”
“I think it’s the chlorine smell from the pool, it’s making me a little queasy.” Grabbing a ginger ale from the fridge, I said, “I’m going to lie down for a little bit.”
*******************
It was not long before my folks came home from work; both of them soaked from walking to the front door in the rain. As he walked into the kitchen, dad turned to me. “John, go check the crawl space and make sure water isn’t pooling up under there like it did last time.”
“Sure thing, dad; I’ll grab a flashlight and check it out.”
I made my way into the garage where there was an access door to the crawl space in the corner. Opening the door, I shined a light down and found that there was currently no water pooling up underneath. Relieved to see that, I walked back into the kitchen and informed my dad of the results.
While my mom got started on dinner, I joined Kate in the family room as she turned on the TV. Looking at me, Kate said, “I don’t know about you, but I’m actually ready for school to start next week.”
“Yeah, I’m kind of ready myself.” Sighing, as I turned on the TV, I said, “As much as school sucks, I’m starting to get sick of staying home all the time.”
“Same here, but there's one reason I'm not looking forward to going back, and it's that bitch Kelly Henderson.” Sighing in annoyance, Kate said, “Just because she’s on the cheer squad, she thinks she’s the most popular girl in our grade.”
“A lot of the guys think she’s attractive.” Blushing slightly, I said, “I’ll admit I’ve always had a thing for blondes.”
“Please tell me you’re joking.” Shocked, Kate said, “She’s stuck up and is a total slacker when it comes to school; she’s the definition of a blonde. Thinking she can get by only on her looks. I worked with her on a group project last year and I ended up having to do the whole project by myself.”
*******************
Later that evening, after the storm had abated somewhat, I was in my room chatting with my cousin Rachel on Skype. Despite being a year older than me and currently living in Virginia, we were close. I was telling her about my discomfort over the last few days and how it had not gotten any better in the last few hours.
“I don’t think that’s because of Kate kicking you, John; if it was you would have gotten better by now.” Pausing, Rachel said, “Sounds to me like you may have gotten a case of food poisoning.”
“I’m not sure; to the best of knowledge I haven’t eaten anything questionable.”
“I got to go, my mom is calling.” Pausing, Rachel said, “Feel better; I’ll see you next month in the Keys.”
155332221.title: like this story

choices: find out that it was not a dream
1553322211.content:
A short time later, after saying good night to my folks, I went to my room to get ready for bed. Still feeling a little queasy from whatever had been affecting me the last few hours, I walked to the bathroom to grab an antacid. As I left the bathroom, I saw my mom walking up the stairs. She must have seen me come out of the bathroom, because she said, “Getting ready for bed, honey?”
“Yeah, I was just getting an antacid for my stomach; I’m starting to feel queasy again.”
“I’m starting to worry about this. If you’re still queasy in the morning, I’m taking you to the hospital.”
“Okay mom, thanks.”
“See you in the morning.”
I walked across the hall to my room and closed the door.
After changing into my pajamas, I climbed into bed. I soon fell asleep, with the thunder in the distance, unaware of how my life was about to change forever.

As I started to dream, I found myself sitting in the bleachers overlooking the football field at my school. Looking around at my surroundings, I saw several teens talking amongst each other a few rows up from me; while the cheerleaders were on the field warming up before practice. As I became aware of the surroundings more, I saw Kelly Henderson walk onto the field. It looked to me as if she was looking for someone; maybe one of the cheerleaders was missing.

Without warning, I suddenly felt the urge to stand up and walk away. After stepping onto the gravel in front of the bleachers, I barely made it 15ft before I heard Kelly’s voice behind me. “There you are, Heather; come on, practice is about to start.”

Turning around, I saw Kelly waving as she walked in my direction. Shrugging it off, I turned and continued to run. It was not long before I felt someone’s hand grab my arm and pull me around. I found myself face to face with the Kelly, who now looked quite annoyed about something. Pulling my arm back, I said, “Let go of me, Kelly.”

“Heather, you can’t just leave before practice starts.” Pausing, Kelly said, “We have a major competition next week, and you in particular need to practice your splits.”

Before I could say anything else, Kelly started pulling me back in the direction of the football field. I tried to pull myself from her grip, saying, “You’re nuts, Kelly; I’m not a cheerleader.”

I soon realized how wrong I was, when I happened to look down and saw I was wearing a cheer uniform; complete with the school colors. Not only that, but I had somehow acquired the figure of a teenage girl. As Kelly pulled me towards the field, I caught my reflection in a nearby window. It was not that of a teenage boy, instead, it was that of an attractive brunette wearing a cheer uniform. Not only that, but she seemed to be mimicking my movements exactly.

As I started to realize the girl was somehow me, I woke up covered in sweat. Sitting up in bed, I thought to myself, “What the hell was that about?”
1553322211.title: continue

15533222111.content:
I suddenly felt very nauseous; so I scrambled out of bed, only to fall flat on my face. As I sat up on the floor, I felt as if I was suddenly off balance somehow. The effect became more apparent when I stood up and walked towards the door; it was as if some extra weight was now on my chest.

I carefully made way over to the door, only to stop when I saw something in the mirror. Unable to see clearly, I reached for the light switch and was shocked by what I saw in front of me. Staring back at my through the mirror was the reflection of the same girl from the dream; only she was now wearing pajamas that were too tight in certain areas.

I started to panic when the reflection copied all my movements; I had somehow been turned into the girl from my dreams. As I slowly placed my hands on what I began to realize were my breasts, I screamed at the top of my lungs and promptly fainted.
From the noise I made my father was alarmed and stormed into my room: He sits next to me on my bed and wanted meu to explain why I screamed that loud?
I was thinking about to explain him my sudden change into a girl, but as he also addressed me as Heather like the others in my dream I was sure he thinks I am and always have been Heather, his daughter….
Since I am scared I decided not talking about this issue, and told my Dad that I only had a bad dream, which was not even a lie. My Dad promises that he is and will be there always for me. I thanked him and he leaves.

Here I am all alone in my room, which was now kind of weird and bizarre, since it was still my room, a more or less but now changed along with my body into a typical young lady’s room.
Looking into the mirror there was no more the man I used to be:
I totally have been replaced by a rather attractive young woman….
Still shocked I went back to my bed, still covered with some strange pajama….
After a while I realized that I was no longer dreaming and somehow this strange and scary dream must have become reality…
It was a weekend so no school and at around 11:00 I went downstairs to see my mum in the kitchen.
I only took out some plain t-shirt I found and some yoga pants:
Mom saw me and said: “Hello darling you don’t look good wearing that old t-shirt…
I wanted to give this later to you, but here I got these for you.” And mom handed me some bag from a typical fashion store for a teenage girls…
I looked inside the bag and found some dress inside.
“Sorry about the color but they were on sale and you know we don't have much money, so sorry again.” Said mom.
I did not want to hurt my mom’s feelings, so I said: “no this is fine, thanks mom”. She smiled and we separated again. I knew that I had to wear this now and show it to mom, damn!

Back in my room I had to see closer what my mother has bought. There was more than the dress inside the bag. Slowly I started to pull out two packs of cotton and lace pink thongs and a few matching bras.
Angry I just threw everything on the ground and went into my bed…

After a while your mom came by: “Sorry darling I have to go to work don't worry there is no rush it's Saturday but I thought you would like to get dressed into the new dress before your friend Dan arrives…”

Damn, I suddenly started to remember that I had arranged something with Dan, my best friend for the weekend, but this was before I have unwillingly turned into a girl….But that appointment seems to be still valid….
15533222111.title: find out that it was not a dream

info.description:
It was a normal day. You had breakfast, played some video games, rode your bike, had lunch, watched TV, had dinner, and went to sleep. But when you woke up, you felt... strange. What happened?
